guideline_id: 2024CSCO肿瘤相关性贫血临床实践指南- .txt

clinical_recommendations.recommendation_content: Initiate evaluation when hemoglobin (Hb) is ≤110 g/L or has decreased by ≥20 g/L from baseline.

Perform tests including reticulocyte count, mean corpuscular volume (MCV); investigate for bleeding (fecal occult blood/endoscopy), hemolysis (Coombs test/DIC screening), nutritional deficiencies (iron/folate/vitamin B12), and renal function (eGFR <60 ml/min).

clinical_recommendations.clinical_context: Diagnosis of iron deficiency in CRA
clinical_recommendations.recommendation_content: Diagnose absolute iron deficiency if serum ferritin (SF) <30 μg/L and transferrin saturation (TSAT) <20%; functional iron deficiency if SF 30-500 μg/L and TSAT <50%.

biomarker_requirements.status: Absolute deficiency if <30 μg/L, Functional deficiency if 30-500 μg/L
biomarker_requirements.testing_guidance: Measure SF level for iron status assessment

biomarker_requirements.status: Absolute deficiency if <20%, Functional deficiency if <50%
biomarker_requirements.testing_guidance: Measure TSAT to confirm iron deficiency type

clinical_recommendations.recommendation_content: Causal treatment and iron supplementation; transfusion for patients with Hb <60 g/L or symptomatic anemia.
Stratify using IPSS/WPSS; use erythropoiesis-stimulating agents (ESA) if serum erythropoietin (EPO) level <500 mU/ml.

biomarker_requirements.testing_guidance: Measure serum EPO level before ESA initiation

clinical_recommendations.clinical_context: Non-chemotherapy-related CRA in palliative care patients
clinical_recommendations.recommendation_content: Transfusion for Hb <60 g/L or symptomatic patients; ESA for asymptomatic patients requiring quality of life improvement.

clinical_recommendations.clinical_context: Chemotherapy-related CRA with severe anemia (Hb <60 g/L)
clinical_recommendations.recommendation_content: Immediate blood transfusion; indicated for massive bleeding, ESA inefficacy, or palliative care requiring rapid symptom relief.

clinical_recommendations.clinical_context: Chemotherapy-related CRA with mild-moderate anemia (Hb ≥80 g/L)
clinical_recommendations.recommendation_content: First-line: Erythropoiesis-stimulating agents (ESA) such as EPO or roxadustat plus iron supplementation. Target Hb: 100-120 g/L; avoid Hb >130 g/L.

biomarker_clinical_significance.clinical_significance: Serum ferritin (SF) and transferrin saturation (TSAT) diagnose iron deficiency types: absolute deficiency (predicts need for iron replacement) and functional deficiency (common in cancer, predicts response to intravenous iron). Erythropoietin (EPO) level >500 mU/ml in MDS predicts poor response to ESA. Inflammatory markers (e.g., CRP/ESR) indicate anemia of inflammation.
